pageContent: Introduction: Prostate cancer is a common health problem in men worldwide. This systematic review has been undertaken to determine if there are differences in incidence of and mortality from prostate cancer between rural and urban men. The understanding of geographical patterns of prostate cancer incidence and mortality is necessary in order to identify and assess any disparities between rural and urban residents in gaining access to healthcare services, such as screening, diagnosis and treatment.

metaData.source:
Surgery Provides Better Oncologic Outcomes than Radiation for the Treatment of Prostate Cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27164513/
